Description: Mould-made double-spouted terracotta lamp in the form of an eagle with spread wings; the head which formed the handle is lost; glossy brown slip.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to be from)
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (581)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Gardner Wilkinson
